```{python}
#| echo: false
import plotly.express as px
import pandas as pd
from datetime import datetime

```

## Minimum
```{python}
#| echo: false
#| fig-width: 100% 

semesters=2
df = pd.read_csv(f'./data/meta/schedule-{semesters}sem.csv')

fig = px.timeline(df, x_start='start', x_end='end', y='description', color='phase', title=f'Gantt chart for {semesters} semesters (Minimum)')
fig.update_yaxes(autorange="reversed") # otherwise tasks are listed from the bottom up

today = datetime.now()
fig.update_layout(shapes=[
    dict(
      type='line',
      yref='paper', y0=0, y1=1,
      xref='x', x0=today, x1=today
    )
])

fig.show()
```
